meanings.definition: Of or relating to a time before the development of scientific methods or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe's healing rituals were prescientific, relying on traditions passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The prescientific beliefs of the medieval alchemists led them to search for ways to turn base metals into gold.
meanings.sent3: The prescientific idea that the earth was flat seemed amusing to the modern-day explorers.
meanings.sent4: In a prescientific world, people believed that illnesses were caused by evil spirits.
meanings.sent5: The prescientific understanding of the stars was limited to simple observations without telescopes.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a period before the application of scientific principles.
meanings.sent1: The prescientific methods used by the ancient builders resulted in structures that still stand today.
meanings.sent2: Her prescientific approach to gardening involved planting based on the phases of the moon.
meanings.sent3: It was prescientific to think that the sun revolved around the earth.
meanings.sent4: The prescientific mindset of the early astronomers hindered their ability to understand the universe.
meanings.sent5: The prescientific worldview of the time saw natural disasters as punishments from the gods.
